page.title: 19EAST LAYTON - Social Club
page.content: In spite of its very small population the village now has a small but thriving Social Club. It is housed in a wooden building on the roadside near the church. The portable structure was bought and erected by members of the village Quoits Club who having joined the local Zetland League found themselves with nowhere to provide refreshment for the visiting teams. All these other teams use the facilities at their respective public houses for this purpose. The Club thus now acts as a Village Hall and is used for darts, dominoes, whist drives and Country & Western concerts. It is thus the social hub of village life. The two quoits teams have been amongst the most successful teams in the area, having been league champions many times&with top individual players
